conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in the electric field first to find the radius in the magnetic field.
Particle starts from rest at point a and accelerates under the influence of the electric field E until it reaches point b.
The work done by the electric field is expressed as W = qEd.
Work done equals the change in kinetic energy of the particle.
qEd = 1/2mv^2, solving for velocity v gives v = sqrt(2qEd/m).
After leaving hole b, the particle enters the magnetic field with velocity v.
Magnetic field exerts a force perpendicular to both the velocity vector and the magnetic field lines, causing circular motion.
Radius R of circular path is calculated using R = mv/qB.
Substitute v = sqrt(2qEd/m) into R = mv/qB to get R = m*sqrt(2qEd/m)/(qB).
Final radius R of the circular path is R = sqrt(2mEqd)/(qB).
